intro: Tabernaemontana brachybotrys, commonly known as the short-stemmed starflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many plants with showy flowers and milky sap. The plant is characterized by its narrow, evergreen leaves and clusters of small, star-shaped white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and greenhouses for its delicate blooms and unique foliage.
